agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for the city of Batesvillle in Franklin and Ripley County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Zoning Appeal Meeting: 1st Thurs 6:30pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Zoning Appeal Meeting: 1st Thurs 6:30pm
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Zoning Appeal Meeting: 1st Thurs 6:30pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service; services limited to properties within Batesville city limits

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
service_description: Provides water and natural gas utility services for the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 7am-3:30pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements.

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, and groundskeeping of public properties in the city of Batesville in Franklin and Ripley County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Elkhart, Kosciusko, Marshall, and St Joseph County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Bartholomew, Dearborn, Decatur, Franklin, Jackson, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland County.

agency_desc: A natural gas utility company serving communities in eastern and southeastern Indiana.
service_description: Provides natural gas service to customers in Dearborn and Ripley Counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 7am-5pm; Fri 7am-noon -- Gas Leak Reporting/ Emergencies: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. Call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides electric service for customers within service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in portions of Dearborn, Franklin, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland counties.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is available at this location.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4:30pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries in Dearborn, Franklin, Jefferson, Jennings, Ohio, Ripley, and Switzerland counties.

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides domestic violence shelter and sexual assault support, as well as nonresidential resources. Offers counseling services, advocates for court hearings, and assists persons in getting needed services.
service_description: Provides shelter and support services for domestic violence and sexual assault victims. Women with or without children stay in a secure, family-style shelter. Accommodations for men fleeing domestic violence may also be arranged. Shelter stay is based on an individual case basis.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Helpline: Daily 24 hours -- Support Groups: Vary
Helpline: Daily 24 hours -- Support Groups: Vary
Helpline: Daily 24 hours -- Support Groups: Vary
Helpline: Daily 24 hours -- Support Groups: Vary
Helpline: Daily 24 hours -- Support Groups: Vary
site_eligibility: Victims of domestic violence or sexual assault

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: An agency that offers services to children and families including prevention services through the Community Partners for Child Safety program.
service_name: COMMUNITY PARTNERS FOR CHILD SAFETY - REGION 15
service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- Contact will be made by a case manager within 48 hours.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - RIPLEY COUNTY
service_description: Provides a drop-off center for recycling paper, cardboard, newspapers, magazines, plastic bottles and jugs (#1-#2), glass, and aluminum/steel cans. This site also has a reuse center where donations of working equipment/tools, household appliances and goods, clothing, books, toys, and other items are offered to anyone at no charge.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information. -- Walk in to drop off approved recyclables. -- Walk in to browse available items in reuse center; take whatever is needed.
site_schedule: Recycling: Mon and Fri 8am-3pm; Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon and Fri 8am-3pm; Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon and Fri 8am-3pm; Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon and Fri 8am-3pm; Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon
Recycling: Mon and Fri 8am-3pm; Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon -- Reuse: Tues and Thurs noon-6pm; Sat 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Open; serves Ripley County

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - BATESVILLE AREA
service_description: Provides a drop-off center for recycling paper, cardboard, newspapers, magazines, plastic bottles and jugs (#1-#2), glass, and aluminum/steel cans.
site_details: Walk in to drop off approved recyclables. -- Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Ripley County

agency_desc: A place of worship that provides free food pantry services and financial assistance by appointment to the eligible residents of Milan.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance when funds are available.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, faith-based volunteer organization focused on helping the disabled and elderly in their community.
service_description: Provides assistance to elderly and disabled individuals who need help building wheelchair ramps or very small construction projects. Agency provides assessments, free estimates, and labor for home modifications and ramps.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Ripley or Dearborn County -- Individuals who are elderly or disabled

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing a crisis pregnancy hotline and other services, including pregnancy testing, post abortion peer counseling, and prenatal and infant supplies.
service_description: Provides free pregnancy testing and counseling.

site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food; personal grooming; and toiletry items to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Drive through for service.
site_eligibility: Living in Ripley County or Sunman-Dearborn School District

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: KING'S DAUGHTERS HEALTH - VERSAILLES MEDICAL BUILDING
service_description: Providing physicals, outpatient services, on site laboratory testing and on-site medical imaging, offers discounted health screenings; x-rays and mammogram's; there is also a diabetes educator available by appointment.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides various funding opportunities for residents through various endowments and funds.
service_description: Provides grants in the fields of community service, social service, education, health, environment, and the arts. Also awards various scholarships.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Community Organizations should be a 501(c)3 to apply for grants -- See website for scholarship information -- Administer endowment funds

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_name: FISHES AND LOAVES COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Ripley County.

service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Ripley County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Milan in Ripley County.

site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Ripley County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Milan in Ripley County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the town of Milan in Ripley County.

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignment, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12 -OR- student living outside of the district with an application

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living, working, or own property in Ray township in Franklin County, Laughery township and parts of Adams township in Ripley County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages in Ripley County.
service_description: Providing public library services; adults, children with books and media collection for Milan and Ripley County areas
site_details: Call for more information
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 10am-6pm; Tues and Wed 10am-7pm; Fri 10am-5pm; Sat 10am-2pm

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and internet access.

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Ripley County.
service_description: Maintains the Ripley County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight lifting, aerobics, and water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, and pool and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website to join or register for specific programs. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Be prepared to provide name and address.
site_eligibility: Living in Ripley County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: A commercial agency that offers a independent living community with assisted living services.
service_description: Providers a meal to older adults, meal includes an all you can eat environment; including  salad bar with bingo and entertainment.
site_details: Call to reserve a meal one day in advance.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older

agency_desc: Is the local county clerk's office that provides marriage licenses, passports and other services such as voter registration.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: A membership organization consisting of members in business, education, not-for-profit sectors, individuals and government.
service_description: Providing local chamber of commerce services and business development. Evaluates programs and activities that promote economic growth and development, working to  enhance the quality of life for the citizens of the Batesville area.
site_eligibility: Batesville resident

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Sunman.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Sunman in Ripley County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Sunman in Ripley County

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Ripley County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment -- For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Ripley County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Is the county auditor's office in Ripley county in southeastern Indiana. Strives to ensure that public funds are spent appropriately and lawfully, in accordance with state and local law in the county.
service_description: Is the auditor's office serving Ripley county in Indiana. Strives to ensure that public funds are spent appropriately and lawfully, in accordance with state and local law in the county.
site_details: Call for an appointment
site_eligibility: Ripley county residents

agency_desc: Parks and Recreation Department for Ripley County.
service_description: Providing recreation services through Parks and Recreation Department.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Ripley County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Ripley County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Ripley County

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_schedule:
-Monthly 2nd Friday 10am-noon
-Monthly 4th Saturday 10am-noon; 10am-11am for those living in Holton; 11am-noon for anyone living in community
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority fortheir respectivecounty, including performing the following duties:controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am
Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 8am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Ripley County. Also oversees traffic court.
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost or free immunizations for County youth (through age 18) who are uninsured, whose insurance does not cover the required vaccination, or who are enrolled in Medicaid. Also provides immunizations for American Indians and Alaskan Natives under age 18 regardless of their insurance status. All school-required vaccines are available, as well as the HPV vaccine.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 2 months through 18 years-old -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
